name: Morsecode As A Service
body:
### Documentation for [morsecode-api.de](http://morsecode-api.de)
This website documents the installation and usage of [morsecode-api.de](http://morsecode-api.de), a side-project I created to create and play around with REST-APIs, node.js and [Heroku](http://heroku.com).

***

#### GET `/encode`
##### Request
Submit one parameter `string` e.g.

`$ curl http://morsecode-api.de/encode/LOVE`

##### Response
The Response has 2 attributes: `plaintext` and `morsecode`, e.g.
```
{
  "plaintext":"LOVE",
  "morsecode":".-.. --- ...- ."
}
````

#### GET `/decode`
##### Request
Submit one parameter `string` and URL-encode the white spaces to `%20` e.g.

`$ curl http://morsecode-api.de/decode/....%20.-%20-%20.`

##### Response
The Response has 2 attributes: `plaintext` and `morsecode`, e.g.
```
{
  "morsecode":".... .- - .",
  "plaintext":"HATE"
}
````


#### Sourcecode and deployment
Get the sourcecode from GitHub.

```
$ mkdir morsecode-api
$ cd morsecode-api
$ git clone https://github.com/repat/morsecode-api.git
```

To start the app, change the `port` variable and run

```
$ nodemon server.js
```

As you might have noticed, the `Procfile` file is an indicator that this code could also be run on [Heroku](http://heroku.com). Assuming that the [Heroku Toolbelt is installed](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/getting-started-with-nodejs#set-up) and the repository is [prepared](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/getting-started-with-nodejs#prepare-the-app) you can follow the normal [instruction](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/getting-started-with-nodejs#deploy-the-app) for deploying an app. Make sure that the `port` variable is set to `process.env.PORT`.
